Camila Cabello’s #1 hits on US Pop radio:
Bad Things
Havana
Never Be the Same
Señorita
My Oh My
Harry Styles' "Adore You" has officially reached #1 at US Hot Adult Contemporary radio. It’s Harry's first #1 hit as a solo artist (Mediabase).
UK mid week: Doja Cat’s "Say So" jumps to #3, Megan Thee Stallion’s "Savage" rockets to #4 & Drake aiming for 3 simultaneous top 10s.

Megan Thee Stallion’s 'SUGA' re-peaks at #10 on this week’s Billboard 200. It was up 39%, aided by the mid-week release of "Savage Remix". She is the only female artist in the top 10 on this week’s Billboard 200.
With 67K sold, the #1 album on the Billboard 200 earns the lowest weekly sales for a #1 debut in over 2.5 years.

Global music industry revenues totaled $20.2 billion in 2019 across all formats, the biggest year for music since 2004.

Taylor, Post, Ed, Billie, Queen, Ariana, Drake, Gaga and BTS were among last year's biggest artists.
Anne-Marie's "2002" has now surpassed 400 million views on YouTube.
Megan Thee Stallion's "Savage" has now surpassed 100 million streams on Spotify.
The Weeknd's "Call Out My Name" has now surpassed 600 million streams on Spotify.

Camila Cabello new US Certifications:

Romance Platinum
My Oh My Platinum
Havana 9x Platinum
For the first time in 35 weeks, the #1 track on the Hot 100 is a collaboration. This ends the longest streak of solo #1's this century.
Beyoncé is not credited on the Hot 100 for "Savage" as total chart points for the remix did not outweigh the original. Credit will be re-evaluated next week.
Post Malone's "Circles" extends its record as the longest running top 10 hit in Hot 100 history (35 weeks).
Travis Scott, Ariana Grande, Britney Spears, Drake, Justin Bieber and Mariah Carey are the only artists to debut multiple songs at #1 on the Hot 100.
Mariah Carey's 'E=MC²' was up 15,969% in US pure sales this week.
Ava Max's "Sweet But Psycho" has now surpassed 900 million streams on Spotify.
Britney Spears' "If U Seek Amy" has now surpassed 100 million views on YouTube.
Megan Thee Stallion and Beyoncé’s "Savage" is currently leading this week’s US streaming and sales race.
Today in 2007, Avril Lavigne's "Girlfriend" reached #1 on the Hot 100.
Today in 2018, Ariana Grande's "No Tears Left to Cry" debuted and peaked at #3 on the Hot 100.
Taylor Swift's '1989' now ranks among the top 100 best selling albums in Soundscan history (6.228m pure).
Kehlani unveiled the tracklist for her new album “It Was Good Until It Wasn’t”, out this Friday.
Lady Gaga is rumored to be collaborating with Fortnite for Chromatica.
